annotation.TEXT: Alright, this spell is just about done.
Now, the boss moves around while firing the amulets, making things a little trickier. I think the red ones are intentionally aimed at you here.
Argh! And another deathbomb! Man, I'm sucking here today! (And look at how high the right number of "Point" is already. Another couple of bombs will pretty much kill my scoring ability.)
At least I kept most of my point value, but now I won't be able to face the "last spell" of this stage...
These "last spells" are all survival spells, by the way, which you have to time out without getting hit to capture.

If you fail a spell in this mode, you get this menu choice. The top option returns you to the spell list, and I think the bottom option is supposed to retry the spell, but it seems to be glitched and doesn't work.
And there we have a bomb! I managed to collect 1.00 power so that I could bomb and get out of trouble there!
Alright, I'm at full power! Now, further power items will decrease the right number of "Point" a lot faster!
Game, set, and match!
Second nonspell is just as easy as the first. Honestly, the stage 4 artificial boss's nonspells looked trickier than this!
Welcome back to Project Nize Festival!
This stage 4 boss is a bit more competent than the other one. No "Icicle Fall Easy" this time around! Dodge the amulets, noting that the red ones are aimed at you here.
Come on, shoot at me and give me more chances to graze!
Another simplified Kaguya imitation. You do have to do some tap dodging here, but you don't have to worry about large shots coming your way like with Kaguya's version.
Now, I'd keep circling the boss like that, but I kind of want to just finish this spell off quickly right now and get to the next thing.
Hmm... I'm thinking that I am doing damage slightly faster while unfocused, but I'm not 100% sure.
Ah, and we have a different background here. However, the stage portion's enemies will still be the same as in stage 6A.

Now, when I bombed, the left number of "Point" went down by 100 (which is what the right number was), then the right number doubled to 200. However, the right number is now way less than 200, due to the power items I've been collecting, so I'm almost fully recovered already.

And now for the "last spell" of this boss. Now, unlike with the other stage 4 boss, you can go ahead and use that blind spot as you circle the boss, and maybe even get some nice graze while you're at it!
Alright, got that spell captured!
This one can be tricky. Follow the blue bands around, and dodge through the red shots as you come to them.
This may look tricky for this forward-firing team, but you are given enough chances to attack the boss here, so don't panic.

Now, as you can see, there are two stage 4s and stage 6s, just like in IN, and also just like in IN, you can play either stage 4 in practice mode, regardless of the team you're using. I'm going with "Artificial" this time, which is what this team would normally play anyway.
And once again, not much is different here.

Unfortunately, since I died earlier, I don't face this stage's "last spell", and I get a "Try No Miss" message. (That message might say "More Shot Power" or "More Point Item" if you failed to qualify for the "last spell" in those ways.)
Got it. Successfully timing out a spell in this mode marks the spell name with an asterisk in front of it.
Also, she'll periodically release a ring of tiny bullets, so watch out for those, too.
This is a great spell to spend nearly the entire time limit graze farming on! But, I'm just going to finish it now and move on to the next pattern.
Well, she's more normal looking than the other stage 6 boss.
Now, this looks the same as the previous nonspell, except the yellow amulets are the ones that are aimed at you this time.
Wow, did that really just happen? I let myself get tagged there too? Oy, that really hurt!
When this spell first starts, move to the lower-left region, then follow the red amulet bands to the right, dodging the aimed yellow shots.
You're probably supposed to stand in the middle here and do some dodging, but even in the middle, there are safe spots!
Speaking of graze farming, her first spell is also a great source of graze (remember the Russia-sized safe spot above her on that one).
Not really anything new to say here.
Awesome! Alright, just two left!

Also, unlike most Touhou games, you always start with 0.00 power and only 3 reserve lives in practice mode, which could make getting started even trickier, depending on the stage and team you've chosen.
...well, that's pretty much it. No other attacks get sent your way, so there's no additional dodging to do! Just sit back and wait for time to run out.
And now for a much harder nonspell... not!
Whoa, that was a tight squeeze.
Do be careful of the tiny white shots, though, but you shouldn't hit them if you don't move too much while tap dodging.
Now this one is I think the toughest of her "last spells". Be ready to do some major dodging here!
The rapidly fired yellow shots aren't aimed at you (at least on this difficulty), so just stay out of their way (though I'll have to get close to them to hit the boss with this team).
Okay, for her first spell... Well, it looks challenging at first, until you discover one of the many safe spots that are littering the field. There's even a safe spot the size of Russia above her!
As you can see, the background is different. However, the enemies in the stage portion will still be the same.
Then, choose a spell on this list (use left/right to access more pages of spells). I'll just pick the first one.
Argh! A bullet somehow hit me just after I had bombed, and I didn't react in time, so I lost a life!
Oh, man. Can I capture this thing?
Okay, and now for the final "last spell"!
If you're careful, you can get some decent graze as well.

Actually, I will point out one thing I didn't mention last time. If you stand right next to the boss during the bullets' phase out period of this spell, you can rack up some graze for some reason. Just make sure to find a safe place to stand in time for the phase in!
This time, I want to show off the other stage 4 and stage 6, as well as another team. Let's use the "Practice" option for that.
And here we have yet another somewhat easy nonspell.
And we'll go with Normal difficulty again, and this time I'm going to use the team that plays like IN's Marisa and Alice, Matatabi Asobi.
Now onto "last spell" number 2, which once again, is a simplified version of Kaguya's. Just find a safe spot (which is a little trickier this time), and sit and wait.
Whoopsie! I got careless and had to deathbomb! If you have at least 1.00 power when you get hit, you get about half a second to deathbomb (or a full second with Clairvoyance).
And it's final boss time! Now, her nonspells are a bit of a let down. This is quite easy to avoid for a stage 6 boss pattern, and it's not really much tougher on the harder difficulties.
It looks tricky, but fortunately, this spell card doesn't seem to have any more HP than her others. (Also, unlike most Touhou games, bombs will damage the final bosses on their final spells here.)
Too bad there's no Nevada-sized safe spot on this spell. Also, on harder difficulties, the boss will also fire at you too, making this one even trickier.
If you're careful, you could continuously graze the red amulet band on your right, but it's not necessary. Oh, during a break in the amulet band, move back towards the lower-left.
Well, I guess that'll be all for this episode. Next time, I'll take on the Extra stage!
"Concept", eh? Well, this one's a little tricky. You'll have to do some dodging.
Same deal as in the last episode. If you want my opinions/strategies of this guy's patterns, watch the previous episode.
Alright, time for the final regular spell!
On Lunatic, she moves around a little bit, which removes many of the safe spots, but the Russia-sized one above her will still be there!
Okay, just ten more seconds and we're home free!
To be continued...
...and then you're dumped right back to the title screen.
Of course, like I said before, I'm going to stage 6B in this episode, so I'll just choose the bottom choice here.
However, you're better off starting from stage 1 if you're going for a high score.
Alright, I'm back up to full power again.
Well, I guess I'll just play through stage 5 again, just for the heck of it. Maybe the FOEs and fairies will be a greater threat when I'm not using homing shots?
Also, you can only select spells that you have encountered in a regular game, which makes sense.
You'll still have to dodge some bullets this way, but not too many, and especially not a ton of them that could suddenly change course on you at the wrong time!

Now, I don't know if this is a glitch, but if you do get hit on these "last spells", they don't end immediately. You'll lose all of your power, or if you have no power, you'll actually lose a life (despite that "Nullify" thing showing up there), so don't get careless.
Sweet! I got the right number of "Point" back down to 100! Now for this spell, stay off the bottom of the screen, because that's where the bullets are coming from!
Well, I've reached the boss, and it's someone new!
Now, this spell appears to be exactly the same as one of the spells of the other stage 4 boss, so the same strategy applies here.
Oh, and with this team, you don't have to go quite as high to autocollect the items (just like in IN). Just look at how low I can be while still autocollecting!
Look familiar? Yep, just find a safe spot between the lines of bullets, and...
Since I'm a bit lacking in power, I'll want to grab the large power up first if possible.
Well, that part went surprisingly well.
Oh, no!

Sweet, but as I said in the previous episode, don't try this with the other stage 4 boss's "last spell", or the bullets will speed up and probably smack you. However, they don't speed up at all on this boss's "last spell".
Now, with no power, this part early on in stage 4 could be a big problem!
However, if you know this spell is coming, you can misdirect the bullets like so and make the whole spell easier! (And remember that you can pass through the boss safely.)
Just do simple dodges around the lines of aimed amulets, and that's it.
Man, I'm getting reckless now. If I keep doing this, I just know I'm going to...
Yeah, and in fact, you do not have to meet any quotas to face these five "last spells"! Even if you're playing on Easy, or you've died on this stage, you'll still face them!
Ah, this is one of the first boss's spells, except that this one doesn't even show up on Easy or Normal.
Ah, but we're not done yet! Remember how Kaguya wraps things up in Imperishable Night?
On harder difficulties, the yellow shots spread out more, making them harder to dodge, and on Lunatic, you'll have to avoid other small bullets as well.
Also, for whatever reason, all spells in spell card practice mode are treated as survival spells, which you have to time out. Normally, you'd defeat this one by depleting the boss's life bar.
And, just like before, there's one last conversation...
Watch out for the bouncing black balls and the bullets surrounding them, of which some will be launched at you.
Okay, now this spell is reasonably hard. Those bullets are roughly aimed at you, and can change direction without warning.
And here's this guy again.

Now, before I end this video, I think I'll quickly show off the "Spell Card" option, which is essentially like spell card practice in IN (or TD, for that matter). I'll just go with the same team again for this.
Alright, for this one, it's tempting to go into the center, but stay on the bottom instead, then do some sideways dodging to get through.
And another bomb gets used (but this one was a normal bomb).
However, the stage 6B boss's five "last spells" aren't selectable here for some reason. You can only face them in a regular game.

Fortunately, I only needed one bomb there. Now when you bomb, all bullets currently on the screen instantly become star items (which are different from small point items, in that they don't add to the "Point" value). Also, you autocollect every item that's on screen at the time of activation.
Deathbombing has the same effect on "Point" as normal bombing, but it takes away 2.00 power (or all of it if you have less than that), and the "circle of doom" sticks around longer.
Also, I'm not sure if I'm dealing more damage while focused or unfocused. Hmm...

That reset my power to 0.00, but dropped three large and four small power items (which typically can give you 2.80-2.90 right back). Also, I lost 10% of the left number of "Point", but the right number was reset to 100.
I'm still going to use the same strategy as last time here.
Whoops, I didn't get the large power up first. Eh, don't worry about it too much. It should only make a 0.05 or 0.10 power difference at most.
Also, this weirdo, who we won't be seeing later in this episode. (He only shows up in stage 6A, but I plan to go to 6B this time.)
Same deal as the last nonspell, except it looks like the yellow amulets are aimed at you here.
You can also do some more grazing if you're careful, but be ready to dodge through the black spreads that come your way.
If I get hit again immediately, I might be better off just dying and losing 10% of my "Point" value, rather than deathbombing and losing 1270 (almost half) from it!
The best strategy I've come up with is to circle around the boss to misdirect the bulk of the bullets, but don't circle around too fast or too slow.
Also, with this team, I've only got primarily forward-firing attacks. That could make some things tricky.
But, how well can I handle the final mook gauntlet without homing shots?
Oh, man. I hate this spell. The bullets do horizontal spreads that can catch you off guard.
I think I went a little too fast around the boss that time, and had to dodge more bullets than usual. At least none of them screwed me over with a sudden course change!

If you're positioned right, you'll safely graze EVERY bullet when they first spawn (that's 217 grazes per wave on this difficulty!), and if you're positioned perfectly, you won't even have to move when the bullets come back after you!

I think this is meant to resemble Kaguya's third "last spell", but it looks more like Yuyuko's Hard/Lunatic-only spell from Ten Desires to me. (Though I think this game predates Ten Desires, so that's gotta be a coincidence.)

...go straight to stage 5? Yes, unlike the Touhou games, after you clear a stage in practice mode, this game just keeps going! So, I guess practice could be seen more like your starting stage of a normal game here.
And I have successfully timed out every spell on this list, and some of them were real doozies ("DAHAROOCA" from the 6A boss comes to mind)!

You want to keep the right number as low as possible. Otherwise, bombing will start really killing your scoring ability, and if the left number is less than the right number after you beat a boss, you can't face that boss's "last spell" (except in a specific case, which I'll mention later).
Actually, forget what I just said. Instead go up and position yourself just above the center of the boss!
Alright, I've cleared stage 4 artificial on practice mode. Now I'll just...

Also, the "circle of doom" that appears will damage any enemy and clear out any bullets it hits. However, bullets fired after the bomb's activation that aren't cancelled by the "circle of doom" are still a threat, as you don't actually become invincible during a bomb in this game.
For this spell, watch out for the red balls that may or may not bounce off the edges of the field (always expect them to bounce).

For this one, move about halfway between the bottom of the screen and the boss. This way, you'll only have to dodge a small amount of slower bullets coming at you from above, and don't have to worry about the really fast stuff below!
And here's our stage 4 artificial boss. I'm going to go through the conversations faster this time around. Pause the video if you really want to try reading them.
Well, there's my first slip up...
